newsitem.title: UK: Tentative deal reached at RTZ's Kennecott.
newsitem.headline: Tentative deal reached at RTZ's Kennecott.

text.p: A tentative agreement between RTZ-CRA's Kennecott Utah Copper and its unions on a new work contract has been reached, Kennecott said in a statement.
The tentative agreement follows talks over the weekend and on Monday and lasts for six years.
"The six year agreement resolves all local issues with Kennecott Utah Copper's 17 local unions, as well as other contractual and economic issues," the statement said.
The union's negotiating team has endorsed the agreement, but the company's 1,800 union-represented employees must vote to ratify the deal, Kennecott said.
The Utah facility was subjected to a two-day strike last week before workers returned to their jobs on Friday.
Kennecott and the union have been negotiating a new contract for the past five months. The previous contract expired at midnight, September 30.
